page.title: 20CHANGES IN STEWARTBY
page.content: laid three miles of wiring, used fifty pounds of gelignite and spent a month preparing the chimneys. "I have had sleepless nights in the past month", he said. Big Bertha contained 149,649 bricks and she was watched by thousands of people including Norris McWhirter and Roy Castle from the Guiness Book of Records. The lady who pressed the button became a "record breaker" since the chimney was the fastest demolition ever. There were also cameras from five television centres including three from the BBC and one from Germany. The event raised about Â£1,000 for charity. New techniques in brick making may ensure that more chimneys are demolished in the future.
